channel.title: [Ubuntu]How to install Apache for linux [Tutorial]
channel.description:
First we install Apache, PHP and mySQL. Open your terminal and type: [code]sudo apt-get install apache2 php4 libapache2-mod-auth-mysql php4-mysql mysql-server[/code]
After that we setup for mySQL password [code]mysqladmin -u root password Here_your_password[/code]
Now you have Apache, PHP and mySQL. Put ur sites now to /var/www/ file
---End----- Now you have working apache web server :D
[b]If you dont want others see your sites, only you want see them only your computer[/b] Write in terminal [code]sudo gedit /etc/apache2/ports.conf[/code]
[b]GD support[/b] Write in terminal [code]sudo apt-get install php4-gd[/code]
[b]PHPMyadmin[/b] Write in terminal [code]sudo apt-get install phpmyadmin[/code] your phpmyadmin's link: http://localhost/phpmyadmin/
Restart after these updates Apache and mySQL [code]sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart sudo /etc/init.d/mysql restart[/code]
[b]IF[/b] Apache or mySQL aren't running [code]sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 start sudo /etc/init.d/mysql start[/code]
_--Please Leave comments....

item.title: [Ubuntu]How to install Apache for linux [Tutorial]
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

[quote=“Kmb, post:2, topic:126349”]You might also want to add the fact that the tutorial is for *buntu Linux only.

Good job anyways.[/quote]

It will work for all Debian distros. Also, I would recommend using xampp which is bundled with PHP, etc., than just Apache.

Read full topic

item.title: [Ubuntu]How to install Apache for linux [Tutorial]
item.dc:creator: @ndugu ndugu
item.description:
@ndugu wrote:

First we install Apache, PHP and mySQL. Open your terminal and type:

sudo apt-get install apache2 php4 libapache2-mod-auth-mysql php4-mysql mysql-server

After that we setup for mySQL password

mysqladmin -u root password Here_your_password

Now you have Apache, PHP and mySQL. Put ur sites now to /var/www/ file

—End----- Now you have working apache web server

If you dont want others see your sites, only you want see them only your computer
Write in terminal

sudo gedit /etc/apache2/ports.conf

GD support
Write in terminal

sudo apt-get install php4-gd

PHPMyadmin
Write in terminal

sudo apt-get install phpmyadmin

your phpmyadmin’s link: http://localhost/phpmyadmin/

Restart after these updates Apache and mySQL

sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart sudo /etc/init.d/mysql restart

IF Apache or mySQL aren’t running

sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 start sudo /etc/init.d/mysql start

_–Please Leave comments…

Read full topic
